Description: Granodiorite seated statue of Sekhmet wearing the sun-disc and a dress with rosettes on the shoulder-straps; Hieroglyphic text on the block-throne including the cartouches of Sheshonq I.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: PM II (2): p.290 G. Pinch, Magic in Ancient Egypt (London 1994), fig.75.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1990 24 Mar-10 Jun, Australia, Canberra, National Gallery of Australia, Civilization: Ancient Treasures from the British Museum, cat no.26 1990 28 Jun-23 Sep, Australia, Melbourne, Museum of Victoria, Civilization: Ancient Treasures from the British Museum, cat no.26 1990 20 Oct-9 Dec, Japan, Tokyo, Setagaya Art Museum, Treasures of the British Museum, cat. no.53 1991 5 Jan-20 Feb, Japan, Yamaguchi, Prefectural Museum of Art, Treasures of the British Museum, cat. no.53 1991 9 Mar-7 May, Japan, Osaka, National Museum of Art, Treasures of the British Museum, cat. no.53 2001-2023, Baltimore, The Walters Art Gallery, LT Loan
Acquisition notes: Erroneously entered as being from the 1835 collection. Salt's Sekhmets were all in the first collection. [NCS 9/2/05].
